parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be assembled together with. From sun and halizo; to accumulate, i.e. Convene.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From chora; to place room between, i.e. Part; reflexively, to go away.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
To wait for, await. From peri and meno; to stay around, i.e. Await.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
